question.text: To which degree are thermoplastic materials cross-linked?
Which of the semi-crystalline engineering plastics from BASF shows the highest crystallinity?
Which of the following statement is true?

answers.answer: Semi-crystalline materials have glass transition temperature only.
Semi-crystalline materials have melt temperature only.
Semi-crystalline materials have both glass and melt temperatures.
Large dependency of properties upon temperature change.
Higher chemical resistance than similar amorphous materials.

question.text: Which of the following materials reveals the highest water uptake?
Which of the following Ultras shows the highest long term service temperature?
Comparing materials with GF30% reinforcement, which base resin results in the best short term heat resistance?
Adding impact modifier can have some negative side effects such as

answers.answer: Material will have higher water uptake.

question.text: The purpose of adding reinforcing fillers is mainly to
Which type of reinforcing additive will result in the highest increase of stiffness?
In order to achieve the highest efficiency in impact modification, it is necessary

answers.answer: To have a homogenous dispersion of the modifier.
To match refractive index of modifier and main matrix.
To add as much modifier as possible.

question.text: What is the advantage of developing polymer blends instead of searching for a completely new class of polymer?

answers.answer: It is very easy to make polymer blends because most polymers are suitable with each other.
Development of polymer blends is typically faster and less capital intensive.
BASF generally does not support the development of new polymers.

question.text: Which polymer blend is part of our product portfolio?
